title: Constancy of the Speed of Light
description: The speed of light in a vacuum is a universal constant, which means that all observers, regardless of their relative motion, will always measure the speed of light to be the same value.

steps.title: What is the speed of light?
steps.content: The speed of light in a vacuum is 299,792,458 meters per second (m/s).
